required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I/II Study of U3-1402 in Subjects With Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 3 (HER3) Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1/2, Multicenter, Non-randomized, Open-label, Multiple-Dose First-in-human Study of U3-1402, in Subjects With HER3 Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This is an open-label, three-part, non-randomized, multiple-dose study to evaluate safety, tolerability, and efficacy of U3-1402 in patients with HER3-positive metastatic breast cancer. HER3 is a unique member of the human epidermal growth factor receptor, which defines a certain type of cancer.
The number of patients and treatment cycles are not fixed in this study. Subjects who continue to derive clinical benefit from the study treatment in the absence of withdrawal of consent, progressive disease (PD), or unacceptable toxicity may continue the study treatment until the end of the trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From signing of informed consent form (ICF) through 28 days after last dose, within about 6 months
primary_outcome.description: To investigate the safety of U3-1402 reporting on frequency and seriousness of treatment emergent adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with tumor response throughout the study using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening until disease progresses, within about 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of tumor response is conducted every 6 weeks in the first 24 weeks and thereafter every 12 weeks until progressive disease to evaluate the efficacy of U3-1402.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in area under the serum concentration time curve (AUC) of U3-1402
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to Cycle 8, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Area under curve at Cycle 1, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 2, Days 1, 8, 15; Cycle 3, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 4,6,8; Day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of U3-1402
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to Cycle 8, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma concentration at Cycle 1, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 2, Days 1, 8, 15; Cycle 3, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 4,6,8; Day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the time to maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of U3-1402
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to Cycle 8, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time of maximum plasma concentration at Cycle 1, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 2, Days 1, 8, 15; Cycle 3, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 4,6,8; Day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the total anti-HER3 antibody from U3-1402
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to Cycle 8, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Cycle 1, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 2, Days 1, 8, 15; Cycle 3, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 4,6,8; Day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the MAAA-1181 level from U3-1402
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to Cycle 8, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the change in MAAA-1181 level from first dose to Cycle 8 at Cycle 1, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 2, Days 1, 8, 15; Cycle 3, Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 15; Cycle 4,6,8; Day 1

arm_group.description: The maximum tolerated dose is determined in the Dose Escalation Part by administering U3-1402 from 1.6 mg/kg to 9.7 mg/kg, administered via intravenous (IV) solution at 3-week intervals.
The recommended dose is determined in the Dose Finding Part by administering U3-1402 at different doses based on Dose Escalation Part results, administered via IV solution at 3-week intervals.

The safety and efficacy of the recommended dose is determined in the Phase 2 Part by administering U3-1402 at the recommended dose determined in the Dose Finding Part, administered via IV solution at 3-week intervals.

intervention.description: An investigational drug, not yet approved for marketing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Has a pathologically documented advanced/unresectable or metastatic breast cancer.
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of 0 or 1.
3. Documented HER3-positive disease measured by immunohistochemistry (IHC) (IHC 2+ or 3+).
4. Has been treated with standard treatment, or for which no standard treatment is available.
5. Has an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status 0-1.
6. Has Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction â‰¥ 50%.
7. Has measurable disease based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1.
Additional Inclusion Criteria for Dose Finding Part and Phase 2 Part
1. Has received 6 or fewer prior chemotherapy regimens including anthracyclines and taxanes.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior treatment with a HER3 antibody.
2. Prior treatment with an antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) which consists of an exatecan derivative that is a topoisomerase I inhibitor (eg, DS-8201).
3. Has a medical history of symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association classes II-IV) or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring treatment.
4. Has a medical history of myocardial infarction or unstable angina.
5. Has a corrected QT prolongation to > 450 millisecond (ms) in males and > 470 ms in females.
6. Has a medical history of clinically significant lung diseases (eg, interstitial pneumonia, pneumonitis, pulmonary fibrosis, and severe radiation pneumonitis) or who are suspected to have these diseases by imaging at screening period.
7. Has cataracts, glaucoma, or increased intraocular pressure at baseline.
